thread.title: Miriam’s husband named adviser on revenue raising
thread.title_full: Miriam’s husband named adviser on revenue raising

title: Miriam’s husband named adviser on revenue raising
text:
Miriam’s husband named adviser on revenue raising By Christina Mendez   Santiago 
  Former interior and local government undersecretary Narciso Santiago Jr. has been appointed presidential adviser for revenue enhancement, the Office of the President said yesterday. 
Santiago, husband of the late senator Miriam Defensor-Santiago, will have the rank of undersecretary. 
Aside from Santiago, the Palace also released the appointment papers of J. Paolo Villa-Agustin Santos as member of the Movie and Television Review and Classification Board (MTRCB) and Louise Acosta as associate justice of the Court of Appeals. 
Acosta will replace retired Associate Justice Agnes Reyes-Carpio, mother-in-law of presidential daughter and Davao City Mayor Sara Duterte. 
Kennedy Trinidad-Costales is appointed executive director III of the Philippine Fiber Industry Development Authority, which is under the Department of Agriculture. 
Batangas Gov. Hermilando Mandanas is designated chairman of the Regional Development Council (RDC) for Calabarzon (Cavite, Laguna, Batangas, Rizal and Quezon), which is under the National Economic and Development Authority (NEDA).   
President Duterte named Juan Carlo Singson Medina as chairman of NEDA-RDC for Ilocos Region.
